title: Subcellular Structure of Pichia pastoris Cells
content: Pichia pastoris is a widely used expression system for protein expression in various biomedical research [1]. As a methylotrophic yeast, Pichia pastoris uses methanol as its carbon and energy source. Previously, the formation of alcohol oxidase (AOX) crystalloids in peroxisomes was observed by electron microscopy [2], and the structures of isolated AOX complexes were investigated by single particle cryo-EM or x-ray crystallography [3]. However, there have not been studies that visualized the close-to-native subcellular structures of the Pichia pastoris cells induced with methanol in vivo. In this work, we investigated the cytoplasmic regions of vitreously frozen Pichia pastoris cells by cryo-electron tomography (cryo-ET) and 3D map segmentation analysis.
